conclusion: There are four objects casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on a green surface. The light source is somewhere above the objects, and when it moves to the back right, the shadows change.
The toilet paper roll is on the left side, and its shadow (C) is pointing towards the top right.
The plate is to the right of the toilet paper roll, and its shadow (B) is also pointing upwards to the right.
The tall thin object is further to the right, and its shadow (D) is pointing in a similar direction.
The circular ring is below and to the right of the plate, and its shadow (A) is also pointing upwards to the right.

premise: In general, when a light source moves, the shadows will move in the opposite direction to where the light is coming from.
conclusion: If the light moves to the back right, the shadows should shift towards the front left.

conclusion: When the light moves to the back right, the shadow (C) should move towards the front left and maybe a bit downward.

conclusion: When the light moves to the back right, the shadow (B) should move towards the front left.

premise: When the light source moves to the back right, the angle between the light and the horizontal line decreases. The distance between the object and the ground and the horizontal displacement of the shadows follow a tangent relationship. As the angle decreases, the tangent value also decreases. However, since the height of the object above the ground remains constant, the horizontal displacement of the shadows increases.
conclusion: A, B, C, and D shift to the front left and become longer.
